The image presents the lesser curvature side of the gastric antrum region of the stomach. An ulcerative lesion of considerable size is observed at this location. The base of the ulcer is covered with a yellowish-white mossy substance, and the surrounding gastric wall folds rise prominently like dams, converging toward the central lesion. Such morphological features are indicative of significant pathological alterations in the gastric mucosa.
